page.title: 01Haywood and Colwich.
page.content: The area is largely farmland with the villages being found in the SE corner of the block. There is evidence of a settlement in this position for at least 1900 years, the site of the original 'Haiwode' probably being what we now call Colwich. The villages have been by-passed with a new road in recent years, considerably reducing the amount of traffic through the villages. Approaching the villages along the A51 they are well hidden on the hills beside the Trent Valley. There has been much development here during the last twenty years: Great Haywood expanded to its present size during the late 1960's and new property is still being built in Little Haywood. Close to Haywood is Cannock Chase, and the home of the Earl of Lichfield at Shugborough.
